channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-12837] Better memory estimation/allocation for hybrid grace hash join during hash table loading
item.description:
This is to avoid an edge case when the memory available is very little (less than a single write buffer size), and we start loading the hash table. Since the write buffer is lazily allocated, we will easily run out of memory before even checking if we should spill any hash partition.

e.g.
Total memory available: 210 MB
Size of ref array of BytesBytesMultiHashMap for each hash partition: ~16 MB
Size of write buffer: 8 MB (lazy allocation)
Number of hash partitions: 16
Number of hash partitions created in memory: 13
Number of hash partitions created on disk: 3
Available memory left after HybridHashTableContainer initialization: 210-16*13=2MB

Now let's say a row is to be loaded into a hash partition in memory, it will try to allocate an 8MB write buffer for it, but we only have 2MB, thus OOM.

Solution is to perform the check for possible spilling earlier so we can spill partitions if memory is about to be full, to avoid OOM.
item.summary: Better memory estimation/allocation for hybrid grace hash join during hash table loading

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
// Destination partition being empty indicates a write buffer
// will be allocated, thus need to check if memory is full

WB can also be allocated if one has already been allocated, if the previous one is close to full. This seems to handle only the small subset of the edge cases... Would the cases where we have one partition with 0 and one with 2 buffers, or the case where we have enough memory for 2N-1 buffers, be handled elsewhere?

Yes, general cases are also handled, in isMemoryFull check. Every time when I check memory, I want to make sure there are enough space to create one write buffer for each partition, otherwise I will spill. Sounds right?

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12781616/HIVE-12837.1.patch
